summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) personnel discussing travel records for Jeffrey Epstein from October 2016 onward. It details numerous international flights on private aircraft, primarily between Teterboro, NJ and Paris, France, as well as travel to/from the U.S. Virgin Islands. The correspondence includes a request for authentication of records for potential court use and notes Epstein's status as a registered sex offender.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject whose international travel records on private aircraft are being analyzed by the U.S. Attorney's Office. The document lists his flights between 2017-2018.

events.title: Flight from Teterboro to Paris
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled outbound from KTEB (Teterboro) to LFPB (Le Bourget, Paris) on private aircraft.

events.title: Flight from USVI to St. Barts
events.description: Epstein traveled outbound from TIST (Cyril E King, USVI) to TFFJ (St. Barts) on private aircraft.

events.title: Flight from Morocco to New York
events.description: Epstein traveled inbound from GMMX (Marrakesh, Morocco) to KISP (Long Island, Islip) on private aircraft.

events.title: Flight from Canada to Teterboro
events.description: Epstein traveled inbound from CYYR (Goose Bay, Canada) to KTEB (Teterboro) on private aircraft.

locations: TIST (Cyril E. King Airport, St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands)
TUPW (Virgin Gorda Airport, British Virgin Islands)
KISP (Long Island MacArthur Airport, Islip, New York)
CYYR (Goose Bay Airport, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein made frequent international trips on private aircraft between 2017-2018, primarily between Teterboro, NJ and Paris, France.
Epstein also traveled extensively to/from the U.S. Virgin Islands and made trips to St. Barts, Virgin Gorda, Morocco, and Canada.

The document notes that if Epstein traveled to territories outside the U.S. (like British Virgin Islands), he would have to report his status as a registered sex offender to U.S. Customs and Border Protection.
Several private aircraft tail numbers are associated with Epstein's travel: N212JE, N120JE, N415LM, N331JE, and N90JE.
The email correspondence is from January 2019 and shows the U.S. Attorney's Office preparing travel records for potential court proceedings.
